weekly_top_story.headline: CDC Formally Stops Recommending Hepatitis B Vaccines For All Newborns
weekly_top_story.summary: The CDC ended its longstanding policy recommending hepatitis B shots for every newborn, advising instead that mothers testing negative consult providers, a decision criticized by experts for ignoring evidence on preventing mother-to-child transmission and potentially impacting millions of infants.

stories.headline: GSK Says US FDA Approved Its Twice-Annual Asthma Drug
stories.summary: The FDA approved GSK's Exdensur as an add-on maintenance treatment for severe asthma in patients aged 12 and older, offering a twice-annual dosing option that could improve adherence and outcomes for a common chronic condition affecting millions.

stories.headline: FDA Approves Label Change For Depo-Provera, Adding Brain Tumor Warning
stories.summary: The FDA updated the label for Pfizer's Depo-Provera birth control shot to warn of meningioma risk, amid ongoing lawsuits alleging prior knowledge, directly affecting patient counseling and prescribing practices for this widely used contraceptive.
